Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.client

Interface HalResourceLoaderBuilder

@ProviderType public interface HalResourceLoaderBuilder
A builder to create and configure a HalResourceLoader instance that is using a custom HTTP client implementation and/or uses a HalResponseCache to cache HTTP responses.

By default (i.e. without calling any methods before build()) this builder will create a HalResourceLoader that is not caching anything, and uses HttpURLConnection to retrieve responses synchronously. You can use withCustomHttpClient(HttpClientSupport) to use a different HttpClientSupport implementation for all HTTP requests.

To enable caching of HTTP responses, you must call withMemoryCache(), withMemoryCache(int, Duration) or withCustomCache(HalResponseCache), and then ensure that the same HalResourceLoader instance is re-used throughout the life-time of your application.

The caching logic will use the HalResponse.getMaxAge() value to determine for how long a response from cache can be used before it is considered stale. If a stale value for a specific URL is found in cache, it is ignored and another upstream request for this URL will be triggered.

By default, only 200/OK responses are being cached, and if the upstream responses do not contain any max-age header, they are only cached for max of 60 seconds. This behaviour can be changed by providing an alternative configuration via withCachingConfiguration(CachingConfiguration).

See Also:
  • RhymeBuilder.withResourceLoader(HalResourceLoader)
  • HalApiClient.create(HalResourceLoader)
  • HttpClientSupport
  • HalResponseCache
  • CachingConfiguration

  • Method Details

    • create

      static HalResourceLoaderBuilder create()
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withCustomHttpClient

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withCustomHttpClient(HttpClientSupport client)
      Replace the default HTTP client with the given implementation.
      Parameters:
      client - the HttpClientSupport implementation to use
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withMemoryCache

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withMemoryCache()
      Enable in-memory caching of responses with default settings. The in-memory cache can contain up to 10.000 HAL+JSON responses, and responses that haven't been read from cache for more than one day will be automatically discarded. If your HAL responses have an average size of 100kb, this can take up to 1GB of memory. You can use withMemoryCache(int, Duration) if you want to use a cache with a smaller or larger memory footprint.
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withMemoryCache

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withMemoryCache(int maxNumItems, Duration timeToIdle)
      Enable in-memory caching of responses with custom settings
      Parameters:
      maxNumItems - the total number of HAL responses that can be stored in cache
      timeToIdle - the duration after which a response that hasn't been read from cache any more will be discarded
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withCustomCache

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withCustomCache(HalResponseCache cacheImplementation)
      Enable caching of responses using a custom caching implementation. This can be used to cache responses in an external, persistent data store.
      Parameters:
      cacheImplementation - an implementation of HalResponseCache
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withCachingConfiguration

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withCachingConfiguration(CachingConfiguration config)
      Replace the default caching configuration that determines which responses are being cached and for how long responses without a cache-control/max-age header will be used. If you don't call this method, only 200/OK responses will be cached, and a max-age of 60 seconds will be used for responses without a max-age value in the header.
      Parameters:
      config - the desired configuration to be used
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withExistingLoader

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withExistingLoader(HalResourceLoader resourceLoader)
      Use a custom HalResourceLoader implementation instead of the default HTTP client. This method only is required if you do already have a full implementation of HalResourceLoader, for which you want to add caching logic by calling one of the caching-related methods of this builder
      Parameters:
      resourceLoader - an existing HalResourceLoader instance
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • withClock

      HalResourceLoaderBuilder withClock(Clock customClock)
      Replace the clock that the caching logic uses to determine the age of cached responses. Only useful for unit-tests where you want to simulate time advancing.
      Parameters:
      customClock - a mutable clock to be use instead of the system clock
      Returns:
      a new instance of HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • build

      HalResourceLoader build()
      Create the HalResourceLoader with the HTTP and caching configuration defined by the previous methods calls
      Returns:
      a HalResourceLoader instance that you should re-use for multiple calls to RhymeBuilder.withResourceLoader(HalResourceLoader) or HalApiClient.create(HalResourceLoader)
